duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide exceptional customer service and product knowledge to guests, ensuring their needs are met and addressing any inquiries or concerns.
Perform point-of-sale transactions and handle cash, credit, and check sales accurately and efficiently.
Stay updated on new products, promotions, and pet-related events in the community to engage with customers and provide relevant information.
Promote teamwork, inclusion, and collaboration within the workplace to create a positive culture for both customers and team members.
Assist in informing guests about adoption events and the company's philosophy on pet adoption.
Maintain familiarity with current promotions, special services, and seasonal training to provide comprehensive assistance to customers.
Evaluate guest inquiries and refer to the appropriate leader as needed, ensuring all needs are addressed.
Uphold safety protocols and contribute to maintaining a safe environment for partners, guests, and pets.
Engage in developmental programs to support continuous growth and development throughout the career.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or GED is generally preferred.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in providing public information related to animal nutrition, care, and wellness/treatment knowledge areas is required.
Minimum of one year in a retail environment is highly preferred.
Basic computer skills and proficiency in using PETCO PetNet and the POLARIS system.
Certification in Companion Animal Departments, Nutrition, and PIJAC (California only) is required.
Thorough understanding of various aspects of Pet Services, including grooming salon programs, dog training class offerings, and vaccination schedules.
